lines.text: Is Listerine good for brains?
Love they tell me is better.
What do you expect for a boat ride? Marlene Dietrich?
Immoral women shouldn't work in banks, you know. They might corrupt the young dollar bills.
You take a lot for granted!
It takes a lot to satisfy me.

[Insinuating after Ruth has been missing from the party]
Oh, so you finally got back!
Did you expect me to be gone all night?

[Insinuatingly]
Well, dear, I didn't know. You see, a girl in your position can afford to be so much more unconventional in her pleasures than I could.
Are you going to laugh at me, or marry me, or cry some more?

[Crying and hugging]
I'm going to do all three at once.

[Pushing her younger sister on the bed, lifting up her dress, and taking off her panty shorts]
A brief pull and then silence.
You're supposed to see things you want, in a bank.
Yes, and the moment you go to get them, burglar alarms start going off all over town.
Eva, Conny isn't back yet.
Did you ever know Ruth to bring a fellow back this early?
Sure.
Who?
Me.
Hawwwwwt potatoes!
Conny's a fool.
Why?
Letting Ruth drag him off outside just like the rest of the fellows that chase her.
He's not fool.
[on the phone to a bank customer]

Yes, Mr. Smith. Yes, Mr. Smith. The balance is correct... perhaps you failed to deduct the government tax. Yes, there's a two-cent tax on every check you write. Oh no, no. Not just for Democrats. The Republicans have to pay it too.

[to Romer Sheffield]
You're considered much too dangerous for local consumption.
If you think you can park me out here, while you go in and flirt with some dizzy little bank clerk, you're crazy.
I'm crazy!
Can't you ever enjoy a boat ride without kissing somebody?
Would it interest you to know that I've wanted you ever since I first saw you in the bank?
You're supposed to see things you want in banks.
Yes, but the moment you go to get them, burglar alarms start ringing all over town.
